website_summaries.verdict: Long-standing, easy-to-use rock tumbler designed for kids and beginners.
pros: Classic kit featuring stones, grit, polish, and instructions
Ideal for use by kids with some adult supervision or guidance

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic wears out before the first batch is done.
customer_reviews.text: This rock tumbler does not get the job done. The polishing grit wore a hole in the side of the rock container before the first batch was done. It's a small hole, but it renders the product unusable. The hole allowed all of the water and polishing grit to flow out. See pictures. Also, the motor and gears are very loud. The hard plastic container makes the rock noise loud, too (some rock tumblers come with quieter, rubber containers). It was far too loud to have in the house, running continuously for the weeks it takes to finish a batch.
customer_reviews.author: Heavin

customer_reviews.title: stage 3-7 to 12 days I think) Great project, but yes it takes forever
customer_reviews.text: Parents be warned, this thing takes about a month to finish polishing the rocks (stage 1-4 days, stage 2-2 weeks, stage 3-7 to 12 days I think) Great project, but yes it takes forever. Also, the canister does leak a little no matter what you do, but not enough to make a mess. You will need to run it under hot water to loosen the lid between cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Complete Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: We gave our grandson one of these NSI Rock Tumbler Classics for Christmas. He was very excited when he opened his gift, but when he tried to use it his excitement disappeared and was replace with sadness. This tumbled didn't rotate the drum is just sat there with the motor humming and the drum sitting still. We tried adjusting the position of the drum, but it didn't work. While the drum was sitting in the machine it dripped because it did not seal completely.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Behnke

customer_reviews.title: One month of torture.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this tumbler. It requires constant "hacking" to keep it running. It will need to run for one month and after that one month it won't be useable. The soft white rubber wears completely down and loses contact with the drum...it seems that whoever designed this does not understand basic engineering or the concept of friction...as both pieces that need to remain in contact to keep the drum turning are completely smooth...ensuring no rotation without "hacking" the drum...you need to be highly optimistic and an engineer just to get through one tumble cycle... Your children will lose interest in the time it takes and you will learn new ways to swear at inanimate objects.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed. What's worse is my students were expecting polished ...
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is a very expensive "cheap" toy. It started leaking after 2 minutes of operation. I followed the directions to the letter to no avail, leaks. I expected noise from tumbling rocks, of course. The motor is louder than the rocks rolling around in the plastic barrel. I wish I hadn't spent so much on this piece of low-quality trash. I'm very disappointed. What's worse is my students were expecting polished rocks, and now I have to disappoint them too.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Terrible poorly made toy.  Completely inadequate and leaks, too
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy admittedly, but still it should be minimally adequate. Despite meticulous care in setting the completely clean sealing O ring and locking the top as instructed, the unit still leaks. Moreover, the tolerances on the drum are such that the drive doesn't make enough contact with drum to drive it without slippage. This can be overcome by putting a large rubber band around the rim of the drum, but why should that be necessary. Poor design and poorly manufactured. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Ada Feldman

customer_reviews.title: My first one broke and stopped rotating. Luckily they ...
customer_reviews.text: My first one broke and stopped rotating. Luckily they replaced it quickly! However, the concoction leaks everywhere through the opening in the barrel. Also, with the second one I had, I applied lube to where the barrel touches the machine, but even so, the friction was so much that it wore down the plastic and is now unusuable. This is only after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Fun to polish a couple sets of rocks
customer_reviews.text: Fun to polish a couple sets of rocks. After that, you will need to purchase more polishing grits and more rocks. (Or even more fun, go find some yourself! Check creek beds for perfect size rocks) I gave it a three stars due to the fact that after just 3 batches, the red tumble barrel is worn and needs replaced, and there is a little rubber gasket that wears down after each batch and constantly needs replaced, or your barrel will stop turning constantly and turn all the inner contents into a hard lump. Fun, interesting, and educational, but be prepared to spend money on many replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to set up and handles very few rocks at once
customer_reviews.text: This was frustratingly difficult to get set up and running without leaks. Yes I did read the directions and used vegetable oil to seal it. But it still leaked. Second issue was that I could only put in 4 small rocks with minimal before the tumbler would get stuck and stop turning. Between that and the leaking, it wasn't worth the hassle to get a few polished rocks after weeks of waiting.
customer_reviews.author: JonMan72

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but a toy... not a long term investment
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy for the price, but is not high quality nor durable. The plastic cylinder lasted for 3 cycles before wearing out. For the price and for a kid who likely wouldn't use it beyond that point anyway, it's a great intro tumbler. The jewelry pieces are very cheap plastic, so it's worth buying a separate kit with some metal jewelry clasps, etc. it's not loud, and does leak if you don't use Vaseline around the seal each time.

customer_reviews.title: The design of this a joke. Out of the ...

I ended up having to modify it by putting a bead of hot glue around the part of the drum the come I contact with the wheel that spins the drum. This immediately fixed that issue. At first when he turned it on the barrel was not rotating but he used his fingers and turned it for a couple minutes like it said on the instructions and then it started. When he gets back to me with his comments and reviews I will post more.

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear of this company and product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my daughters birthday. After assembling the drum it leaked like a sieve. I re-installed the O-ring numerous times without solving the leak. My best guess is that their engineer who developed the drum apparatus was comatose or on a bender when he he came up with this design. I had one as a child which used a simple threaded cap design (like a mayonnaise jar) and it never failed. After 3 phone calls and 2 emails I received a replacement drum 30 days later. Guess what? it leaked too! As a Prime member it will be going back. Steer clear of this company - horrible product and even worse customer service.

customer_reviews.title: I will shop for a forth step finer polishing grade
customer_reviews.text: Five weeks of consecutive tumbling (in garage), all three grades of compound (10 days with the finale polishing compound) I thought the rocks would be more shiny. Next batch, I will shop for a forth step finer polishing grade. It did serve the purpose just fine. Bought necklace and key-chain blanks and the granddaughter made her Christmas gifts.

customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. Received the tumbler from Amazon, then left for two weeks. When I returned I ran the tumbler once and that was the first and last time it worked. I guess the bottom line to this story is don't buy inferior merchandise from Amazon if you go on vacation and don't plug in and use within 10 minutes of delivery. Amazon: why such a sort warranty? You should print the 30 days warranty in bold letters on the order page.

customer_reviews.text: My only problem with the product was that it didn't turn as it was supposed to. I had to fashion a grip on the lip to catch the wheel, so it would turn. For those of you new to rock polishing, this is great... But it takes weeks to get your rocks done and is energy consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy McIlquham

customer_reviews.title: Prefect finish not achieved
customer_reviews.text: Our budding scientist received this machine for Christmas. It has been noisily rumbling in our guestroom for weeks on end, and no mattter how long it tumbles the rocks, the final steps fails to get a glossy shine on anything. They are smooth, but not shiny. Suggestions??

customer_reviews.text: Worked wellish for the stones that it came with. Got a hole on the side of it when I put in some Kyanite. You get what you pay for. Ordering a better quality one when I get my next paycheck.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The drum broke and the rocks bore a whole through the drum. Barely got any use out of it. Very weak design.

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea this thing had to run for ...
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea this thing had to run for 7 days straight for the first step, then 14 days straight for the second step, then another 7 for the last. Make sure you have a garage to let this thing run continuously in.

customer_reviews.text: I am writing another review about my Rock Tumbler I purchased. I commented that the tumbler was fine but the rocks that came with it sucked, it was like pieces of slate. I have had no issues I'm on my third batch of rocks and the Machine is still working fine however I do not give 5 stars because the initial batch of rocks included are not of that great quality pretty much rocks you can find in your driveway luckily I have gone to other gemstone mines and I hadplenty of my own gemstones to tumble great purchase good fun would recommend to other people

customer_reviews.title: roch tumbler classic
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this rock tumbler just to do small sets of rocks but two things I find darn near impossible.. First no matter what I do it leaks.. So I put tape around the lid.. It helped a bit, but the worst is to get the top off.. Impossible once a little grit leaks into that seal. I sure would not order another till I saw how it sealed.. Got to be a better way.
customer_reviews.author: craigf

customer_reviews.title: Has some issues
customer_reviews.text: No matter how well you tighten the end of the drum, it's gonna leak and ruin the seal more with each use. Was fun to use for the kids though while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Teaches kids about rocks AND patience!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is 5 and loves rocks. He is also very impatient. But his daddy explained to him that he was able to do in one month what nature took thousands of years to do. He was amazingly satisfied by this. Great toy if the kids love rocks!
